did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle:
Pittsburg,
Shawmut & Northern Railroad Company papers, 1872-1960

persname.normal: Allen, C. F. H. (Charles Francis Hitchcock), 1895- , collector

did.physdesc:
Letters, pamphlets, broadsides,
maps, newspapers, and photographs.
did.repository:
Division of Rare and Manuscript
Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract:
Allen's history of the railroad, with
research notes and correspondence; a corporate history. Railroad material
includes correspondence, reports, financial records, employee records,
timetables, pamphlets, newspapers, broadsides, maps, blueprints, charts, and
photographs. Also records of predecessor, affiliated, or otherwise connected
railroads.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p:
Allen's history of the railroad, with research notes and
correspondence; a corporate history. Railroad material includes correspondence,
reports, financial records, employee records, timetables, pamphlets,
newspapers, broadsides, maps, blueprints, charts, and photographs. Also records
of predecessor, affiliated, or otherwise connected railroads.

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.persname:
Allen, C. F. H. (Charles Francis
Hitchcock), 1895- , collector.
controlaccess.corpname:
Pittsburg, Shawmut and Northern
Railroad Company.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p:
Pittsburg, Shawmut & Northern Railroad Company papers, #2161.
Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

did.unittitle: Timetables

Original timetable printed on red cardboard of the
Buffalo and Susquehanna Railroad Co. effective June 15,
1896. This is an oversize
file.

Photocopy of the Buffalo and Susquehanna Railroad Co.
effective June 15, 1896.
Loose-leaf notebooks
did.abstract:
A count of all the photographs and material
other than actual text in these volumes follows.
THESE PHOTOGRAPHS AND OTHER MATERIAL MUST BE COUNTED EACH TIME ANY OF THESE
VOLUMES IS REMOVED FROM THE STACKS AND RECOUNTED BEFORE THEY ARE RETURNED TO
THE STACKS (see note signed by E.M.F. in box with books).

scopecontent.p:
1. Contains material relating to the predecessor roads and
subsequent affiliated roads to the Pittsburg, Shawmut & Northern Railroad;
incl. 156 pp. typescript of text by Mr. Allen and other items as noted
below.

2. Contains a complete history of the Pittsburg, Shawmut &
Northern R.R. itself. pp. 157-254 + illustrations, etc. as noted below.

3. Contains clippings and miscellaneous railroad ephemera -
passes, etc. pp. 255-265 + unnumbered pp. of photos, etc. Additions, KJ,
5/62.

travel on various lines (issued to different individuals); map of Allegany
County, N.Y. (1929) showing railroad lines.

- Engine #577

p. 265 Text and
page numbers end with this page. The balance of this book consists of
photographs, railroad ephemera and letters. The following page numbers are,
therefore, my own and serve only to locate the material listed. The pages bear
no numbers or other means of identification. (The page numbers used indicate
the number of the page following p. 265).

#214

#202

#210

Schenectady

Engine #200

lettered Allegheny River Mining Co.

#202

switch

& Co., Dec. 1900.

p. 18 3
employees' passes issued to R. Soranson for year 1908
(nos. 107, 381, 946), P.S.&N. RR. Co.

p. 19 3
employees' passes issued to R. Soranson for year 1909
(nos. 96, 433, 729) P.S. & N. RR. Co.

employees' passes: Central N.Y.&Western RR. Co. to E. C. Lapey (?)
1897; P. & S. RR. Co. to R. Soranson 1918
and 1919.

p. 21 1
employees' pass, P.S. & N. RR. Co. to R. Soranson,
1909 (for one trip only)

p. 22 P.S.
& N. RR. Co. first timetable after Bolivar-Angelica linked Dec.
27, 1903.

p. 23 P.S.
& N. RR. Co. timetable Nov. 25, 1906

p. 24 P.S.
& N. RR. Co. timetable, June 16, 1935 (last timetable
of line); clipping from St. Mary's Daily Press,
Dec. 24, 1947 re approval of
fees awarded to Shawmut receivers and trustees, and legal counsel

p. 25 P.S.
& N. RR. Co. timetable #22 Dec. 15, 1940 (last
timetable before Angelica-Bolivar linked)

p. 26 Page #287
of a record book indicating scrap salvage value of engine #2 (photostat of this
sheet is in book #2 marked as P. 195 -- this was apparently the original P.
195)

p. 27 Letter
dated April 27, 1912 to I. B. Irvin (foreman, Angelica
Shops) from H. S. Wilgus (Engineer, Maintenance of way) re disposition of surplus boiler tubes

p. 28 Letter
dated May 7, 1912 to H. S. Wilgus from J.A.B. indicates no
use in Shops for boiler tubes

p. 29 Photostat
of letter dated Jan. 28, 1919 to J. L. Smith (Sup't.
Motive Power & Equipment) from (name illegible) re
insurance on boilers damaged in Angelica Shops fire.

p. 30 Order
dated April 30, 1912 signed J.A.B. for work train to load
& distribute gravel

p. 31 & 32
2 page letter dated June 18, 1912 to H. S. Wilgus from
Tait & Tait (attorneys) re responsibility of
railroad for maintaining all highway crossings in good condition.

p. 33 Letter
dated July 2, 1912 to J.A. Benson, roadmaster, from H.S.
Wilgus notifying roadmaster of letter from Tait & Tait
re crossings

p. 34 Letter
dated July 13, 1912 to J. A. Benson from H.S. Wilgus
asking about responsibility for large rock that cannot be extricated from car
4338; (also pencilled notes from Benson to Krebs and Krebs' reply)

p. 35
P.S.&N. RR. Co. Steam Shovel Report for July 25, 1912

p. 36 Letter
dated August 26, 1912 from H. S. Wilgus to J. A. Benson
re fences from Canaseraga to Hornell knocked down
by sideplow.

p. 37 Letter
dated August 27, 1912 from Wilgus to Benson
re faulty construction of sideplow

p. 38
P.S.&N. RR. Co. Daily Steam Shovel Report, Sept. 9,
1912

p. 39 P.S.
& N. RR. Co. gravel loading resume, Nov. 22, 1911-Oct. 8,
1912

p. 40 Message
dated Nov. 11, 1912 to Benson asking for advice as steam
shovel is burying itself in quicksand - initialed W.W.N. (?)

p. 41 Photocopy
of letter dated April 23, 1915 from B.C. Mulhern
P.S.&N. General Superintendent) to I.B. Irvin (General Foreman)
re payment to W.P. Cannon for services performed
during last half of March

p. 42 Photocopy
of letter dated June 9, 1919 from Frank Sullivan Smith
(receiver) to I.B. Irvin (General Foreman, Angelica Shops) asking for specific
reasons for resignation of several of the shop's employees.

p. 43 Letter
dated Oct. 8, 1942 from F.H. Wells (general freight and
passenger agent) to C.F.H. Allen re permission to
photograph locomotives

p. 44 Letter
dated Oct. 30, 1942 from F. E. Berg (Sup't. Motive Power
& Equip.) to C.F.H. Allen referring Allen to W.W. Robinson of Batavia for
information and supplying some information about specific cars &
engines.

p. 45 & 46
Two page letter dated Nov. 5, 1943 from F.H. Wells to
C.F.H. Allen - answers to specific questions re
P.S. & N. developement

p. 47 Letter
dated May 27, 1947 from Thomas C. Buchanan (trustee of
P.S.&N.) to C.F.H. Allen - reply to letter asking for map of line,
corporate history and annual reports.

p. 48 Letter
dated June 13, 1947 from Thomas C. Buchanan to C.F.H.
Allen -- reply to request for information.

p. 48 & 49
Letter and sheet of information dated April 4, 1944 from
Allen G. Geertz (fuel engineer) to C.F.H. Allen re
information about specific engines

p. 50 - 61
Newspaper clippings from several papers (1939-1945)
covering coal mining operations of P.S. & N. and the subsequent labor and
financial difficulties leading to the road going into receivership

p. 62 Personal
letter dated Dec. 20, 1945 from Soranson to Allen
re information about mismanagement of road by
former officials

p. 63 - 70
Typescript copies of newspaper articles from the Pittsburgh Post-Gazette and the Pittsburgh Press Sept.-Dec. 1945
supplied to Allen by Soranson

p. 71 Letter
dated Jan. 23, 1946 from Soranson to Allen (and three
newspaper clippings) concerning period of coal miners' strike and appointment
of new management for the line.

p. 72 - 92
Series of 21 letters from Soranson to Allen (and newspaper clippings)
Jan. 23, 1946-Dec. 7, 1947 concerning post receivership
period of the P.S.&N.

p. 93 Letter
dated Jan. 14, 1946 from J. Taney Willcox (secretary,
Pennsylvania RR.) to C.F.H. Allen re extent of
Rochester, N.Y. & Pa. RR. owned lines.

p. 94 Letter
dated May 7, 1947 from F. H. Wells to C.F.H. Allen
re disposition of records of P.S. &
N.

p. 95 Letter
dated May 20, 1947 from Thomas C. Buchanan to C.F.H. Allen
re possibility of obtaining railroad records that
would otherwise be destroyed.

p. 96 Letter
dated June 2, 1947 from J. N. Thompson (General Manager)
to C.F.H. Allen-cover letter for items sent (map, corporate history &
Timetables)

p. 97 Letter
dated June 5, 1947 from F. M. Opel (General Auditor) to
C.F.H. Allen re request for certain railroad
records.

p. 98 Chart
showing development of P.S. & N. from parent and subsidiary
companies

p. 99 (no. 8 at
top of page) Notes re Soranson's comments on early
mining attempts in Pa. by railroads

p. 100 Titled
"Notes from Mr. Lathrop, call of 2-19-49 "
re people connected with P.S. &N.

p. 101 Letter
dated Feb. 13, 1949 from Fred C. Hill to Allen
re pictures of old locomotives

p. 102 Letter
dated Jan. 18, 1949 from R. J. Finch (Chief Mechanical
Engineer, American Locomotive Co.) to Allen re
information and photographs of old locomotives

p. 103 Letter
dated Feb. 1, 1949 Finch to Allen - similar to letter of
Jan. 18.

p. 104 Letter
Dated Feb. 4, 1949 Finch to Allen - similar to previous
two letters

p. 105 Letter
dated Feb. 11, 1949 from Gerald M. Best (vice-president,
Ry. & Locomotive Hist. Soc.) to Allen in answer to questions about
locomotives built at the Cooke Works

p. 106 Letter
dated April 12, 1949 from J. D. Dickinson (M'gr.
Locomotive Sales, Lima-Hamilton Corp.) to Allen re
locomotives built by the company for the Buffalo, St. Marys &
Southwestern line

p. 107 Letter
dated Mar. 4, 1949 from Luria Bros. & Co. to Allen in
answer to query on final disposition of certain locomotives

p. 108 &
109 Letter dated Feb. 8, 1952 from Interstate Commerce
Commission to Allen re locomotive numbers and
disposition of these (P.S.&N. locomotives)

p. 110 - 112
Letter dated April 23, 1950 from Roscoe Davis to Allen
providing information about the Marvin Creek operations (lumbering)

p. 113 Chart -
titled "Engineering Dept. Blueprint" dated Oct. 24, 1909
did.abstract:
This is a copy (made with blue ink on ordinary white
paper showing the names, mileage of various predecessors, and subsidiary lines
to the P.S.&N. and also indicating dates of construction and mergers. [This
page is loose-not punched and on rings].

did.unittitle: Miscellaneous Envelopes
did.abstract:
This box contains material that is separated as to
subject matter. The material is, for the most part, in manila envelopes. Each
envelope bears a legend as to its contents. The following list includes the
legend on each envelope and a physical inventory of the contents.

did.unittitle:
1. Shay
Locomotives (Railroads in Western N.Y. & Pa. for Goodyear roads - B. &
S. component parts - Kaul & Hall, St. Mary's, Pa.)

2. Letters from S.
R. Wood (mostly on pertinent engines), 1950-1957

3. Map P.S.&N.
(Large, accurate)

4. Shawmut notes
of C.F.H. Allen (correspondence on C. N.Y.&W. locomotive #43. Probably it
was the repair engine "Danbury"), 1950.

5. Loose note
re Jones, pres. of Buffalo, N.Y.&Pa.
etc.)

6. W.N.Y.&Pa.
(old engines [photos] - several negatives B&S.-Erie [maps]),
1951.

7. Photo of
Prattsburgh Ry. No. 2 (ex-Buffalo, Rochester & Pittsburg No.
126)

8. Loose-letter
dated Nov. 30, 1951 to Allen from S.R. Wood (and list of
engines) re engines built by Brooks Locomotive
Works.

9. Original copy
(and 2 copies) of news clippings on P.S.&N. from Mr. Lathrop's
books.

10. Derailment
Reports, Boiler Inspections, Records showing lines and ownership (valuable for
tracing back) 1908-1914.

11. Miscellaneous
Shawmut (1899, narrow gauge receipts;
1900 local T.T.; 1919 about boilers
of 2 locomotives 11 and 18 and one narrow gauge; 1908
"paper"; Nugent's bridge list [published]; 1903
T.T.

12. Shawmut 8 Ã 10
enlargements:

13. C.N.Y.&W.
timetable, April 24, 1899, #17

14. Shawmut Stock
Certificates (correspondence 1953, photostats and stock
certificates). 30 Mss. pcs. (includes 9 photostats of certificates and 12
original certificates).

15. Evidence that
there was a No. 2 (not on the Clarion River) 7 Mss. pcs. (all photostats -
duplicates of p. 195 in notebook).

16. Clarion River
(photos of engines & map (4 copies) of line

17. P.S.&N.
original of circular on Stony Brook Bridge. 6 Mss. pcs. (Circular
1907; 4 sheets of specifications for Lord & Lady
Baltimore engines; B. & O. loaded car certification card -
blank).

18. Latest used
notes - last P.S.&N. typing - R.Wy & P. and early parts;

19. P.S.&N.
"paper" misc. notes from junk. 46 Mss. pcs. (includes 2 Blueprints of bridge
masonry foundations).

20. P.S.&N.
rolling stock pages sent to S.R. Wood - Parts omitted from P.S.&N.
bulletins 92, 93, 96 -- largely personal items which should have been used. 115
Mss. pcs. (included 2 photostats of sections of line).

21. Part 3
P.S.&N. (published) correspondence on locomotives included
(1955-1956).

22. 2 maps
(includes 3 blank pass request forms, Pittsburgh Press,
June 1, 1947 article on P.&S. attempt to
attract industry along line, maps of P.S.&N. and Lehigh and New England
routes).

23. Loose material
(seniority roster of enginemen of P.S.&N. and three typescript memos, 2
copies of descriptive pamphlet welcoming visitors of Nat. Ry. Hist. Soc.
May 30, 1954 P.&S. RR.; 15 page typescript of minutes
of 20th executive staff meeting, Jan. 29, 1908
P.S.&N.).

24. C.N.Y.&W.
"paper" (historically valuable), 1899-1923.

25. A lot of
Chapman letters, L. & S.W. 1889-1890 (vice-president
Lackawanna & Southwestern RR.).

26. Allegany
Central "paper" - L. & S.W. train orders from file of F.S.
Hammond.

27. L. & P.
paper 1886-8 (valuable, especially the payroll draft). 3
Mss. pcs. (payroll draft dated Oct. 15, 1886 on Chatham
National Bank of N.Y. pay to order of Dan'l. McCartey $11.63).

28. Soranson's
letters - mostly Shawmut (but he mixes subjects, so some may be B.&S.,
etc.). Some about people living and could not be published with other parts of
P.S.&N. articles (e.g. - John B. Dickson,
et al.) 1942-1948. 54 Mss.
pcs. (attached to letter, Oct. 19, 1942, between pp. 2
& 3, is a playing card, the joker, sent to Allen because of the lithograph
on the back. The card is not counted as part of the 54 pcs.)

29. "to give away
[?]" - Boiler inspection, etc. 1909-1935.

30. P.S.&N.
original picture - new shipment of engines arrives at Angelica from Mott's
(probably only one extant).

31. Inspections,
Stationary Boiler #5889 (or #1-3) Shay gear #693 (#11, 14, 18, old locomotives)
1913&1917.

32. P.S.&N.
Corporate History - Old timetables - Blueprint of P.S.&N. (very large -
folded). 1 Mss. vol. (typescript of corporate history, blueprint bound in with
this, as of the date of valuation June 30, 1919 - Office
of Auditor May 31, 1923 ).

1 pamphlet
(P.S.&N. timetable #2, Nov. 15, 1903 - this has been
folded as it is rather large. The edges are torn in several places and it is in
generally fragile condition.)

33. P.S.&N. -
extra copy of roster - I.C.C. 3 pp, of 2nd copy - C.N.Y.&W.
earlydrafts.

34. Used notes -
L.&P., L.&S.W., C.N.Y.&W., P.S.&N., R.N.Y. & P.

36. P.S.&N.
mostly enlargements - one original and rare print.

37. Nile Wreck -
extra pictures from Mott's negatives.

38.
Allegany County Advocate, Jan. 9,
1902, Angelica, N.Y.

39.
Simpsons' Daily Leader, August 22,
1913, Kittanning, Pa. (story on first train run on Pittsburg &
Shawmut line). 1 newspaper - single issue [in very poor condition].

40. R.R. maps -
Allegany Cty. L.&S.W. -- N.Y. State 1894, 1900 -
P.S.&N. 1900, photo copies. 23 photos (includes maps,
timetables and correspondence).

41. Bullis letters
- McKean County and Western N.Y. railroads 1948-1957.

42. Mostly about
the Kanes Mt. Jewett K.&R. RR. (Kushequa Line); also Kane & Elk RR.
(Elk City, McKean County), 1909-1950.

43. Nugent's
letters - mostly Shawmut, 1948-1952.

44. P.S.&N. -
list of negatives of C.F.H. Allen and Mott collections -- class numbers of
Shawmut locomotives.

46. P.S.&N. -
older locomotives (2. L.&P.; 1. P.&S.).

47. Buffalo &
Susquehanna (Wellsville & Buffalo?), Soranson's letters, etc.,
1943-1947.

48. A few of
P.S.&N. negatives from C.F.H. Allen's collection (there are copies of
timetables, stock certificates, maps, passes).

50. 2 maps of N.Y.
RR's. 1894 and 1900.

51. P.S.&N.
"Janelyn" business car and subsequently in use in Mexico.

52. Erie Narrow
Gauge System - also Pennsy narrow gauge system and miscellaneous small roads,
Penna. RR. maps, 1930-1950.
did.physdesc:
42 Mss. pcs., 24 photos, 16 maps, 1 newspaper
clipping.

did.unittitle: Box #3

35. Shawmut
correspondence (all sources) 1942-1960.

1. Envelope marked
"Shawmut Real Estate"

-- charts
indicating physical description of road (# of bridges, lengths, etc.) and other
information (such as annual labor outlay, etc.)

-
1920-1947, Lease of Edward B. Simmons, Angelica, N.Y. -
for pasture lands.

- abstracts of
title for land owned by Linus Graham and apparently sold for railroad
right-of-way, Allegany County, N.Y., 1893, 1901

- photostatic
copies of pp. 166, 167, 168, 169, 170, 173 of a (unknown) deed book, indenture
conveying lands of - the Rochester, Nunda & Penna. RR. Co. to the Allegany
Central RR. Co. by sale forced by foreclosure of mortgage (p. 173 is a sketch
showing the stretch of track near Swain, N.Y., part of which was a horseshoe
curve), 1881.

- deed conveying
lands held in trust by Frank Sullivan Smith to the Shawmut Holding Corporation
(executed by Clara A.H.H. Smith, executrix of F.S. Smith estate).

2. 4 Mss. pcs. -
agreement between P.S.&N. and Belvidere Block Corp. for construction and
maintenance of spur track (p. 1 of agreement is missing).

3. Envelope marked
"copy of P.S.&N. map, with connecting lines inked in by C.F.H.
Allen.

4. Envelope marked
#35 mm. negatives"

Old RR's. N.Y.
Comm. map 1884

Nile Wreck map
by Nugent

Mt. J.K.&R.
timetables 1912

P.S.&N. 1902
map and timetables

Stony Brook Glen
new bridge

Sketch maps -
Clarion River RR, Mt. J. & S. RR.

P.S.&N.
flyer "loop de loop" 1903 timetable

C.N.Y.&W.
inspections

Lathrops
P.S.&N. clippings,

Copies
L.&S.W. timetable - L.&S.W. letter of George Chapman

One strip
unidentified

5. Envelope marked
all P.S.&N. from J. W. Brauner 33 photos, 1 Mss. pc. (Aug. 17,
1952 cover letter for photos)

6. Blueprint of
Main Line of B.&S. - Sagamore to VanHusen only.

Track chart,
Alignment & Profile 1 map (rolled as it is very
long)

7. Loose-leaf
cover filled with photographs

8. 3 Ã 5 file
cards, arranged alphabetically, -- information consists of name of individual,
to which road or line he was connected and position or positions
held.

9. Two iron spikes
from

a. Kane &
Elk RR., James City, Pa. abondoned Jan. 1946

b. Clarion River
RR., Pa. abandoned 1948
